resources.string: QuizApp
How well do you know NYC?
1. How many boroughs are there in NYC?
2. Which borough is not located on an island?
3. Which of the following are modes of public transportation in the city?
4. Which of the following lines are still in operation?
5. Which store will you not find in NYC?
6. There have been 15,152 life forms identified on the NYC subway.
7. Homeowners can request that a tree be planted outside their homes for free in NYC.
8. Approximately 500 languages are spoken in NYC.
Your Score:
There are five boroughs in New York City: The Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and Staten Island.
The Bronx is the only borough not located on an island.
New York City has many modes of transportation. However, it does not have any maglev trains.
There are many large retail store in NYC, however there are no Walmart stores.
There are over 15000 types of microscopic life forms found on the NYC subway!
A request can be submitted to the Department of Parks and Recreation or by calling 311 to plant a tree on the street in front of your home.
There are over 800 different languages spoken in NYC!
Subway
Aerial Tram
Maglev Trains
